20101228030143.000|20101228030146.000|TR0|questions are being raised by a pilot who 
20101228030146.000|20101228030148.000|TR0|says he works for a major airline.  He 
20101228030148.000|20101228030150.000|TR0|says the Transportation Security 
20101228030150.000|20101228030152.000|TR0|Administration,, the TSA, is not 
20101228030152.000|20101228030154.000|TR0|protecting the flying public, that while 
20101228030154.000|20101228030156.000|TR0|passengers and flight crews are subjected 
20101228030156.000|20101228030158.000|TR0|to pat- downs and body scans, ground crews 
20101228030158.000|20101228030201.000|TR0|are not.
20101228030201.000|20101228030203.000|TR0|
20101228030203.000|20101228030205.000|TR0|So, anybody on the tarmac could put 
20101228030205.000|20101228030207.000|TR0|explosives on a jet.  His name is Chris 
20101228030207.000|20101228030209.000|TR0|Liu.  And, until tonight, he kept his 
20101228030209.000|20101228030211.000|TR0|identity a secret, for fear he might lose 
20101228030211.000|20101228030214.000|TR0|his job.  To prove his point, Liu took his

20101228030429.000|20101228030431.000|TR0|permitted him to carry a firearm in the

20101228030922.000|20101228030924.000|TR0|years who -- who said that absolutely what 
20101228030924.000|20101228030926.000|TR0|Chris had to say was true.
20101228030926.000|20101228030929.000|TR0|
20101228030929.000|20101228030931.000|TR0|We have also heard from hundreds of pilots 
20101228030931.000|20101228030933.000|TR0|-- I won't say hundreds -- a lot of pilots 
20101228030933.000|20101228030935.000|TR0|-- who all have confirmed the same 
20101228030935.000|20101228030937.000|TR0|security problem exists.  You know, I

20101228031921.000|20101228031923.000|TR0|
20101228031923.000|20101228031925.000|TR0|You can't get all of that out of the way 
20101228031925.000|20101228031927.000|TR0|at a time.  So, here's our problem.  We 
20101228031927.000|20101228031929.000|TR0|have 10,000 people that were -- or 20,000 
20101228031929.000|20101228031932.000|TR0|people that didn't get to where they were 
20101228031932.000|20101228031934.000|TR0|trying to get to today.  Now they're going 
20101228031934.000|20101228031936.000|TR0|to try to get on planes tomorrow.  Those 
20101228031936.000|20101228031938.000|TR0|planes only have 10 empty seats.  What are 
20101228031938.000|20101228031940.000|TR0|you going to do with 20,000 people trying 
20101228031940.000|20101228031942.000|TR0|to get on 10 empty seats, and then another 
20101228031942.000|20101228031945.000|TR0|10 on the next plane and another 10 on the

20101228032136.000|20101228032139.000|TR0|overheating, New York City hammered with 
20101228032139.000|20101228032141.000|TR0|20-plus inches of powder and drifts even 
20101228032141.000|20101228032143.000|TR0|higher, with winds gusting over 35 miles

20101228032145.000|20101228032147.000|TR0|commuter's hell under it.

20101228032209.000|20101228032211.000|TR0|adding, 911 emergency calls were running

20101228032700.000|20101228032702.000|TR0|Saturday afternoon, December 19, according 
20101228032702.000|20101228032704.000|TR0|to the Frontenac, Missouri, Police 
20101228032704.000|20101228032706.000|TR0|Department. Paramedics arrived eight 
20101228032706.000|20101228032708.000|TR0|minutes later and pronounced the 
20101228032708.000|20101228032710.000|TR0|27-year-old mother and former model dead 
20101228032710.000|20101228032712.000|TR0|at 1:26.
20101228032712.000|20101228032715.000|TR0|
20101228032715.000|20101228032717.000|TR0|According to the police report, there were 
20101228032717.000|20101228032719.000|TR0|no apparent signs of trauma or other

20101228032725.000|20101228032728.000|TR0|KSDK.
20101228032728.000|20101228032730.000|TR0|
20101228032730.000|20101228032732.000|TR0|ART MARGULIS, ATTORNEY FOR AUGUST BUSCH 
20101228032732.000|20101228032734.000|TR0|IV:  There's absolutely nothing that 
20101228032734.000|20101228032736.000|TR0|indicates there's anything suspicious 
20101228032736.000|20101228032738.000|TR0|about this.  It's just a tragic 
20101228032738.000|20101228032740.000|TR0|circumstance, a tragic death of a young -- 
20101228032740.000|20101228032743.000|TR0|a young lady, a very nice young lady, as a 
20101228032743.000|20101228032745.000|TR0|matter of fact.
20101228032745.000|20101228032747.000|TR0|
20101228032747.000|20101228032749.000|TR0|WIAN:  Martin's death marks the second 
20101228032749.000|20101228032751.000|TR0|time that a woman Busch was seeing has 
20101228032751.000|20101228032753.000|TR0|died.  In 1983, while a student at the 
20101228032753.000|20101228032756.000|TR0|University of Arizona, Busch crashed his 
20101228032756.000|20101228032758.000|TR0|Corvette.  His 22-year-old female 
20101228032758.000|20101228032800.000|TR0|passenger was ejected and killed.  Busch 
20101228032800.000|20101228032802.000|TR0|left the scene and was later found bloody, 
20101228032802.000|20101228032804.000|TR0|dazed and with a fractured skull.
20101228032804.000|20101228032806.000|TR0|
20101228032806.000|20101228032808.000|TR0|After seven months of investigation, 
20101228032808.000|20101228032811.000|TR0|authorities dropped the case because of 
20101228032811.000|20101228032813.000|TR0|insufficient evidence.  In 1985, Busch was 
20101228032813.000|20101228032815.000|TR0|involved in a car chase on this highway 
20101228032815.000|20101228032817.000|TR0|with undercover narcotic detectives, who 
20101228032817.000|20101228032819.000|TR0|ultimately shot out his tire.
20101228032819.000|20101228032821.000|TR0|
20101228032821.000|20101228032824.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED MALE:  The officers were 
20101228032824.000|20101228032826.000|TR0|almost hit by the -- Mr. Busch's car 
20101228032826.000|20101228032828.000|TR0|traveling at a high rate of speed west on 
20101228032828.000|20101228032830.000|TR0|Highway 40.
20101228032830.000|20101228032832.000|TR0|
20101228032832.000|20101228032834.000|TR0|WIAN:  Busch was acquitted of assault.
20101228032834.000|20101228032836.000|TR0|
20101228032836.000|20101228032839.000|TR0|Busch was home on December 19 when Martin 
20101228032839.000|20101228032841.000|TR0|was found.  According to the police 
20101228032841.000|20101228032843.000|TR0|report, there were no apparent signs of 
20101228032843.000|20101228032845.000|TR0|trauma or other indications of cause of 
20101228032845.000|20101228032847.000|TR0|death.  Martin's ex-husband, who is a 
20101228032847.000|20101228032849.000|TR0|doctor, told "The Saint Louis 
20101228032849.000|20101228032852.000|TR0|Post-Dispatch" that she had a heart rhythm 
20101228032852.000|20101228032854.000|TR0|disorder that called long QT syndrome 
20101228032854.000|20101228032856.000|TR0|that, in some cases, can cause sudden 
20101228032856.000|20101228032858.000|TR0|death.
20101228032858.000|20101228032900.000|TR0|
20101228032900.000|20101228032902.000|TR0|She had been dating Busch, the former CEO 
20101228032902.000|20101228032904.000|TR0|of Anheuser-Busch, for a year.
20101228032904.000|20101228032907.000|TR0|

20101228033611.000|20101228033613.000|TR0|fact, the Kaiser Family Foundation says 
20101228033613.000|20101228033615.000|TR0|some 30 percent still do.
20101228033615.000|20101228033617.000|TR0|
20101228033617.000|20101228033619.000|TR0|So in 2009 Democrats dropped the 
20101228033619.000|20101228033622.000|TR0|end-of-life planning provision from the 
20101228033622.000|20101228033624.000|TR0|reform package altogether.  Fast forward 
20101228033624.000|20101228033626.000|TR0|to Christmas day 2010, just two days ago, 
20101228033626.000|20101228033628.000|TR0|when this article appeared in "The New 
20101228033628.000|20101228033630.000|TR0|York Times," despite stripping end-of-life 
20101228033630.000|20101228033632.000|TR0|counseling from the health-care reform 
20101228033632.000|20101228033635.000|TR0|bill signed into law last March, the White 
20101228033635.000|20101228033637.000|TR0|House is moving forward with the plan.
20101228033637.000|20101228033639.000|TR0|
20101228033639.000|20101228033641.000|TR0|As of January 1, the government will pay 
20101228033641.000|20101228033643.000|TR0|doctors who advise their Medicare patients 
20101228033643.000|20101228033645.000|TR0|on end-of-life care options.  It's all 
20101228033645.000|20101228033647.000|TR0|part of a new Medicare policy folding what 
20101228033647.000|20101228033650.000|TR0|the government calls voluntary advanced 
20101228033650.000|20101228033652.000|TR0|care planning into each Medicare patient's 
20101228033652.000|20101228033654.000|TR0|annual checkup.
20101228033654.000|20101228033656.000|TR0|
20101228033656.000|20101228033658.000|TR0|In other words, the White House is doing 
20101228033658.000|20101228033700.000|TR0|by regulation, what Congress could not do 
20101228033700.000|20101228033703.000|TR0|by legislation.  But the White House is 
20101228033703.000|20101228033705.000|TR0|quick to deny credit.  According to a 
20101228033705.000|20101228033707.000|TR0|spokesman, the end-of-life counseling 
20101228033707.000|20101228033709.000|TR0|benefit actually became law under 
20101228033709.000|20101228033711.000|TR0|President Bush.  The only thing new here, 
20101228033711.000|20101228033713.000|TR0|the official says, is a regulation 
20101228033713.000|20101228033715.000|TR0|allowing these discussions to happen as    
20101228033715.000|20101228033718.000|TR0|   part of the patient's yearly checkups 
20101228033718.000|20101228033720.000|TR0|or what they call "wellness visits." those 
20101228033720.000|20101228033722.000|TR0|are the facts.  But what does it mean for 
20101228033722.000|20101228033724.000|TR0|your family's health?

20101228033835.000|20101228033837.000|TR0|KAYE:  And Maria, why would you say the 
20101228033837.000|20101228033839.000|TR0|White House is so keen on giving credit

20101228034548.000|20101228034550.000|TR0|
20101228034550.000|20101228034552.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20101228034552.000|20101228034554.000|TR0|
20101228034554.000|20101228034557.000|TR0|SANJAY GUPTA, CNN CORRESPONDENT 
20101228034557.000|20101228034559.000|TR0|(voice-over):  Scott Jurek has been called 
20101228034559.000|20101228034601.000|TR0|"the King of Pain" and the greatest ultra 
20101228034601.000|20101228034603.000|TR0|marathoner ever. Ultra marathons can be 
20101228034603.000|20101228034605.000|TR0|125 miles longer than a typical 26-mile 
20101228034605.000|20101228034607.000|TR0|marathon.
20101228034607.000|20101228034610.000|TR0|
20101228034610.000|20101228034612.000|TR0|Scott finished his first in 1994, and 
20101228034612.000|20101228034614.000|TR0|since then, he's dominated the sport.  
20101228034614.000|20101228034616.000|TR0|Today he holds records for races that 
20101228034616.000|20101228034618.000|TR0|cover more than 150 miles and last over 24 
20101228034618.000|20101228034620.000|TR0|hours straight.       A notoriously tough 
20101228034620.000|20101228034622.000|TR0|ultra marathon is the 135-mile Bad Water 
20101228034622.000|20101228034625.000|TR0|in Death Valley, California.  The 2005, to 
20101228034625.000|20101228034627.000|TR0|get through the 135-degree heat, Scott was 
20101228034627.000|20101228034629.000|TR0|dunked in this king-sized cooler full of 
20101228034629.000|20101228034631.000|TR0|ice water.
20101228034631.000|20101228034633.000|TR0|
20101228034633.000|20101228034635.000|TR0|Halfway through the race, he collapsed, 
20101228034635.000|20101228034638.000|TR0|and for ten minutes he didn't move.  But 
20101228034638.000|20101228034640.000|TR0|he managed to get up and not only finish 
20101228034640.000|20101228034642.000|TR0|the race but shatter the course record.
20101228034642.000|20101228034644.000|TR0|
20101228034644.000|20101228034646.000|TR0|Scott says it was his mother, Lynn, who 
20101228034646.000|20101228034648.000|TR0|taught him how to persevere.  She died 
20101228034648.000|20101228034650.000|TR0|last March after living with multiple 
20101228034650.000|20101228034653.000|TR0|sclerosis for 30 years.
20101228034653.000|20101228034655.000|TR0|
20101228034655.000|20101228034657.000|TR0|(on camera) So what propels you to be able 
20101228034657.000|20101228034659.000|TR0|to do some of these things?  Running the 
20101228034659.000|20101228034701.000|TR0|distances you do?  A lot of people 
20101228034701.000|20101228034703.000|TR0|wouldn't even dream of it.
20101228034703.000|20101228034706.000|TR0|
20101228034706.000|20101228034708.000|TR0|SCOTT JUREK, ULTRA MARATHONER:  I think 
20101228034708.000|20101228034710.000|TR0|for me it's that self- exploration, that 
20101228034710.000|20101228034712.000|TR0|idea of there's something out there and 
20101228034712.000|20101228034714.000|TR0|the desire to see what my body, what my 
20101228034714.000|20101228034716.000|TR0|mind and down to what my spirit can do.
20101228034716.000|20101228034718.000|TR0|
20101228034718.000|20101228034721.000|TR0|GUPTA:  Do you think anybody can do this?

20101228034723.000|20101228034725.000|TR0|JUREK:  I think anybody can run an ultra 
20101228034725.000|20101228034727.000|TR0|marathon.  I know that's...
20101228034727.000|20101228034729.000|TR0|
20101228034729.000|20101228034731.000|TR0|GUPTA:  Really?  Because I was reading all 
20101228034731.000|20101228034734.000|TR0|about you, and the first thing I thought 
20101228034734.000|20101228034736.000|TR0|was, "I don't think I could ever do this."
20101228034736.000|20101228034738.000|TR0|
20101228034738.000|20101228034740.000|TR0|JUREK:  It really is -- I like to say that 
20101228034740.000|20101228034742.000|TR0|running an ultra marathon is 90 percent 
20101228034742.000|20101228034744.000|TR0|mental, and the other 10 percent, that's 
20101228034744.000|20101228034746.000|TR0|mental, too.  So you know, really, 
20101228034746.000|20101228034749.000|TR0|somebody who has it in their mind that 
20101228034749.000|20101228034751.000|TR0|they can accomplish this can really do it. 
20101228034751.000|20101228034753.000|TR0| Maybe everybody isn't made to be a runner.
20101228034753.000|20101228034755.000|TR0|
20101228034755.000|20101228034757.000|TR0|GUPTA:  Were you always a runner?  I mean, 
20101228034757.000|20101228034759.000|TR0|how did this start?
20101228034759.000|20101228034802.000|TR0|
20101228034802.000|20101228034804.000|TR0|JUREK:  For me, I actually used to hate 
20101228034804.000|20101228034806.000|TR0|running.  I grew up hunting and fishing in 
20101228034806.000|20101228034808.000|TR0|northern Minnesota, and that really was 
20101228034808.000|20101228034810.000|TR0|where I got connected with the outdoors.  
20101228034810.000|20101228034812.000|TR0|And I had got interested in running 
20101228034812.000|20101228034814.000|TR0|through Nordic ski racing and had to get 
20101228034814.000|20101228034817.000|TR0|ready for the, basically, the snow season

20101228034821.000|20101228034823.000|TR0|GUPTA:  You obviously do this

20101228034832.000|20101228034834.000|TR0|165.7 miles...

20101228034838.000|20101228034840.000|TR0|

20101228034842.000|20101228034845.000|TR0|
20101228034845.000|20101228034847.000|TR0|GUPTA:  So tell me how that works.  Are 
20101228034847.000|20101228034849.000|TR0|you taking breaks or what are you doing?
